DOC.brief_summary: The purpose 52-week clinical trial see meditation-based intervention , adjunctive standard care therapy , reduce relapse improve psychological health among adult recover alcohol dependence .
DOC.detailed_description: The goal partially-blinded , two-arm clinical trial test whether Mindfulness Meditation Relapse Prevention ( meditation ) , combine 'standard care ' ( SOC ) therapy , effective prevent return drink SOC alone ( wait-list control ) among adult recover alcoholic . The intervention manualized base exist model . It propose meditation may improve outcome interest reduction severity stress-related relapse risk factor perceive stress , anxiety , depression , crave emotion dysregulation , level stress-sensitive biomarkers ( cytokine interleukin-6 , liver enzymes ) . For study , 123 adult alcohol dependent subject recruit collaborate treatment center , randomly assign one two equal study arm , follow 26-weeks ( Period 1 , Randomized Controlled Trial , RCT ) . The RCT evaluate efficacy meditation intervention use self-reported alcohol consumption primary , drinking-related harm subject treatment satisfaction adherence secondary outcome . It also gather preliminary data potential mechanisms meditation action . After completion 26-week RCT ( Period 1 ) , control eligible receive meditation intervention ( `` cross-over '' ) , participants followed-up additional 26 week ( non-randomized Period 2 ) . This study provide evidence efficacy meditation alcohol relapse prevention , understand relapse potential mechanism meditation action , direct future research guide clinical decision-making .
